conclusion: Use Faraday's law of induction to determine the EMF induced in the coil.
Faraday's law: EMF is equal to the negative rate of change of magnetic flux through the coil.
Magnetic flux through a coil is given by Φ_B = B ⋅ A.
Half of the coil is in the magnetic field.
Effective area A is 1/2 a^2 since only half of the coil is in the magnetic field.
Initial magnetic flux Φ_{B_i} through one turn is 1/2 B a^2.
Total initial magnetic flux Φ_i for n turns is 1/2 n B a^2.
Final magnetic flux Φ_{B_f} through one turn is B a^2 when magnetic field increases to 2B.
Total final magnetic flux Φ_f for n turns is n B a^2.
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ is 1/2 n B a^2.
Induced EMF is -ΔΦ/Δt = -n B a^2/(2 Δt).
Magnitude of the induced EMF is n B a^2/(2 Δt).
